list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve had a quarrel with my girlfriend.

list_definition.definition: to have an angry argument (with someone)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My girlfriend and I have quarrelled.

list_ex_of_english: They have no quarrels with the policy as such.
Neighbours conversed across the street and quarrelled noisily.
Far be it from me to wish to see two elder statesmen quarrelling in this way.
The quarrels between them can be settled by a little common sense and consideration on both sides.
Nevertheless, despite continuing inheritance quarrels, a parliamentary social democracy does appear to be taking shape.
Indeed, this array of motives was quite as important as the more obvious causes of quarrels : royal, religious or fiscal policies.
Too often, while there are quarrels within our industries, out competitors jump in and run off with the orders.
They saw that it would be utterly absurd for them to carry on their quarrels.
